data.title: Stranded far from home
data.statement:
An Explorer is stranded in the middle of the wilderness. She knows exactly where she and the other nearby cities are on the map, however, she only has enough rations for a certain distance!

You need to help her by finding if she can reach a city in time, and if she can, which city would be the closest!
data.stubGenerator:
read explorerX:int explorerY:int

read maxDistance:int
read N:int
loop N read x:int y:int

write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1 : >>  Two <<integers>> [[explorerX]] and [[explorerY]] containing the current position of the explorer
<<Line 2:>> an <<integer>> [[maxDistance]] the largest distance the explorer can cover 
<<Line 2:>>  an <<integer>> [[N]] the number of cities on the map
<<[[N]] next Lines :>>  Two <<integers>> [[x]] and [[y]] as the coordinates of one city
data.outputDescription:
If the explorer can reach a city, the {{one-based index}} of the city the explorer has to go to.
If she cannot, you will return the string {{STRANDED}}

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

An Explorer is stranded in the middle of the wilderness. She knows exactly where she and the other nearby cities are on the map, however, she only has enough rations for a certain distance!

You need to help her by finding if she can reach a city in time, and if she can, which city would be the closest!
Input
Line 1 : Two integers explorerX and explorerY containing the current position of the explorer
Line 2: an integer maxDistance the largest distance the explorer can cover
Line 2: an integer N the number of cities on the map
N next Lines : Two integers x and y as the coordinates of one city
Output
If the explorer can reach a city, the one-based index of the city the explorer has to go to.
If she cannot, you will return the string STRANDED
Constraints
0 <= x <=99
0 <= y <=99
Example
Input
0 0
2
2
1 0
0 2
Output
1
